page.title: 01Countryside around Ravensden
page.content: This thriving agricultural region of North Bedfordshire has a scattering of unspoilt villages. Patches of deciduous woodland and neat tessellating fields occupy the quiet countryside which rises above the valley of the River Ouse. The fields are mostly arable, threaded together by footpaths. Strolling along these paths kaleidoscopic views are to be had as the colours change from greens to gold to brown, heralding the sequence of the seasons. The ripening rape and wheat are harvested, the ground ploughed and sowed and the growth cycle recommences. Many of the cottages have thatched roofs and the stone churches round which they cluster have mini-spires jutting above the parapets of the towers.
